channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Steel’s stock surges as Trump gets his wish and a ‘golden share’
item.description: U.S. Steel’s so-called “partnership” with Nippon appears to be nearing its end after about 18 months after it was announced.

item.title: ‘I’m 68 and my 401(k) has dwindled to $82,000’: My husband committed financial infidelity and has $50,000 in credit-card debt. What now?
item.description: “I have $3,000 in gold and Social Security income for me and my spouse makes $46,180 a year.”

item.title: Deutsche Bank says looming tariff deadline and this other risk are what investors should care about now
item.description: Deutsche Bank says worry about a looming tariff deadline and inflation.

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict poses three challenges for stocks that could slam market by up to 20%, warns RBC
item.description: Spiking oil prices may muddle the Federal Reserve’s inflation forecasts

item.title: My mother-in-law, 95, has $400K in stocks. Would it be smarter taxwise to gift it to her kids — or leave it to them in her will?
item.description: “What is the smartest way to go about this? Will she be taxed?”

item.title: Welding project uses robotics to crunch 12 workhours into 45 minutes

item.title: Rethinking AI: DeepSeek’s playbook shakes up the high-spend, high-compute paradigm
item.description: DeepSeek's advancements were inevitable, but the company brought them forward a few years earlier than would have been possible otherwise.

item.title: SCHURTER releases UHP high-current SMD fuse for humanoids

item.title: Just add humans: Oxford medical study underscores the missing link in chatbot testing
item.description: Patients using chatbots to assess their own medical conditions may end up with worse outcomes than conventional methods, according to a new Oxford stu...

item.title: The case for embedding audit trails in AI systems before scaling
item.description: With more AI applications and agents going into production, enterprises need robust and auditable AI pipelines more than ever.

item.title: Do reasoning AI models really ‘think’ or not? Apple research sparks lively debate, response
item.description: Ultimately, the big takeaway for ML researchers is that before proclaiming an AI milestone—or obituary—make sure the test itself isn’t flawed
